channel.title: My new computer
channel.description:
I think its pretty bestly what about you?
It has:
8gb RAM 1tb hard drive AMD Phenom(tm) II x4 945 processor 3.00 ghz 64 bit OS

item.title: My new computer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

plus they can be destroyed easily with no trace that I even had them…just in case.

But that is what huge magnets hidden inside a door frame is for! (this happened in real life :))

Personally though, I like having all my data available all the time with no physical plugging or unplugging, so I can access any of it from anywhere all the time.

Read full topic

item.title: My new computer
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

I guess I didnt explain myself when I said 500gb on builds. I have about 3-4tb total of external harddrives but I would never put that much into a pc. I usually store movies and music on it. I don’t like having my movies and music on my main harddrive because then I cant transport the files easily, plus they can be destroyed easily with no trace that I even had them…just in case.

Read full topic

item.title: My new computer
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

I just recently maxed out my 500gb external, it’s mostly movies and music, as well as the occasional software suite and such. Took me two or three years to do that though so for me, 1tb would probably be plenty(which I have between my internal and external)

Read full topic

item.title: My new computer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“cumescape, post:18, topic:363301”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=459554.msg3362704#msg3362704 date=1286517205]
router:

$ df -h
Filesystem            Size  Used Avail Use%
/dev/sdb1             9.2G  2.9G  5.9G  33%
/dev/sda1             296G  270G   11G  97%
/dev/sdb2             221G  196G   15G  94%
/dev/sdc2             227G   93G  123G  43%
/dev/sdd1             232G  219G  734M 100%
/dev/sde5              29G   25G  2.6G  91%

[/quote]
I am sorry what? I don’t see how your router would need to store that much information.[/quote]

I ran out of space for hard drives in my desktop, so I store stuff there and access it across my 1Gbit network. My ‘router’ is actually a dedicated 1U server with a Quad core intel and 6gb of ram, running Ubuntu Server, I run various other services on it as well such as a PS3 media server, samba server, squid caching proxy and torrentflux. So it is a router, but not in the normal sense.

Read full topic

item.title: My new computer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Like I said, 1TB seems small to me:

router:

$ df -h
Filesystem            Size  Used Avail Use%
/dev/sdb1             9.2G  2.9G  5.9G  33%
/dev/sda1             296G  270G   11G  97%
/dev/sdb2             221G  196G   15G  94%
/dev/sdc2             227G   93G  123G  43%
/dev/sdd1             232G  219G  734M 100%
/dev/sde5              29G   25G  2.6G  91%

desktop:

$ df -h
Filesystem            Size  Used Avail Use%
/dev/sdd3              37G   32G  3.0G  92%
/dev/sde1             233G  137G   97G  59% 
/dev/sdd1             426G  279G  148G  66%
/dev/sdc1              98G   79G   19G  81%
/dev/sdc2             597G  400G  167G  71%
/dev/sdb1             1.4T  804G  502G  62%
/dev/sda1             233G  7.7G  226G   4%

item.title: My new computer
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Well you list no video card. 8gib of ram is overrated unless you do major video/photo editing and I do that and I only have 4gb or ram.

Moparisthebest:

Only 1TB of hard drive space seems pretty small, maybe that’s just me though. Otherwise, what about the video card? That’s the part that can make or break a gaming computer.

I only do one 500gb drive when building new computers…saves money and are more reliable most of the time because of the number of slates.

Read full topic
